contents.item: Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting some on yourself.
We buy things we don't need with money we don't have to impress people we don't like.
contents.owner: Dave Ramsey, The Total Money Makeover: A Proven Plan for Financial Fitness

contents.item: Just because you are happy it does not mean that the day is perfect but that you have looked beyond its imperfections
There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.
The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.
There are two ways to be happy: improve your reality, or lower your expectations.

People tend to think that happiness is a stroke of luck, something that will descend like fine weather if you're fortunate. But happiness is the result of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly.
It's a helluva start, being able to recognize what makes you happy.
Humanity does not ask us to be happy. It merely asks us to be brilliant on its behalf.
Memory is the happiness of being alone.
My God, a moment of bliss. Why, isn't that enough for a whole lifetime?
Is anyone anywhere happy?
contents.owner: Sylvia Plath, The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

contents.item: Later she remembered all the hours of the afternoon as happy -- one of those uneventful times that seem at the moment only a link between past and future pleasure, but turn out to have been the pleasure itself.
contents.owner: F. Scott Fitzgerald, Tender is the Night

contents.item: But maybe happiness isn't in the choosing. Maybe it's in the fiction, in the pretending: that wherever we have ended up is where we intended to be all along.
I don't know what good it is to know so much and be smart as whips and all if it doesn't make you happy.
The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.
Everybody in the world is seeking happiness—and there is one sure way to find it. That is by controlling your thoughts. Happiness doesn't depend on outward conditions. It depends on inner conditions.
contents.owner: Dale Carnegie, How to Win Friends and Influence People

contents.item: To be stupid, and selfish, and to have good health are the three requirements for happiness - though if stupidity is lacking, the others are useless.
Growing old is mandatory. Growing up is optional.
Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.
